title: GTTK1
content:
Stats:
Normal distribution- Distributed around a central value w/no bias left or right. 
Spread- Standard deviation is a typical measure of the spread data. 
Standard Deviation- Is the square root of the variance. So the variance is the average of the square differences from the Mean.  
F-Statistic- Yields a probability(p-value) that differences are due to chance. F= (between group variability)/ (Within group variability). 
Interpreting Data- 1. Come up w/ a hypothesis 2. Conduct Study(Users & tasks-context, Procedure, Measures) 3. Interpret Results. (Mean, Distribution, Spread, F-statistic: basic measures) 
Data Analysis:
Descriptive-Describes behaviors and changes (overall or individual)
  • Periodicities
  • Spikes
  • Shifts
*Question: What is happening?
Relational- How are things that are happening related to each other?
Causal- What factors cause what is happening?
Information Model- Entity: People or objects, Location: Spatial or Conceptual, Event: Occurrences or discovered facts
V's
Velocity, Variety, Volume, (Veracity, Value)
  • Volume- Data at Rest (Terabytes to exabytes of existing data to process) 
  • Variety- Data in many forms (structured, unstructured, text, multimedia)
  • Velocity- Data in Motion (streaming data)
  • Veracity- Data in Doubt (uncertainty due to data inconsistency & incompleteness.)
